H0.text: what government does new zealand have. Federal Republic

H1.text: what government does new zealand have. Constitutional Monarchy

H2.text: what government does new zealand have. Parliamentary Democracy

H3.text: what government does new zealand have. Unitary state

A4.text: The New Zealand Government is the central government through which political authority is exercised in New Zealand. As in most other parliamentary democracies, the term 'Government' refers chiefly to the executive branch, and more specifically to the collective ministry directing the executive.

A5.text: The New Zealand Government is formally styled [His] Majesty's Government in the Seal of New Zealand Act 1977. This is a reference to the monarch, King Charles III, who is the head of state under the Constitution Act 1986.
